ygData.subject: Re: re to latest stuffs :)
ygData.msgSnippet: again, my wifes ogre sk just bought a halberd, and she is hitting dervs for 28 a crack...that is real damage, heh. Pets also give her xtra damage, and if shit
ygData.messageBody:
again, my wifes ogre sk just bought a halberd, and she is hitting dervs for
28 a crack...that is real damage, heh.
Pets also give her xtra damage, and if shit gets deep, gives hr three steps
to the door, while mob beats her pet..
no chasing down monsters, she can lure...
I see alot of advantages to the sk, and when she can start lifetapping
too...
They are mean, no doubt about it..
Spells are what ya make of em, ya gotta look at all the ins and outs..
and they are something a warrior will never have....
whats skill does a warr get that you dont?
kick? newbie only skill...bash/slam way better
duel wield? bah, two handed and can still bash./slam
Ermm, healing is a problem, all tanks gotta deal with...
Whatcha want, a super character?

----- Original Message -----
From: Brian Hook <bwh@...>
To: <shadowknight@onelist.com>
Sent: Friday, April 30, 1999 9:04 PM
Subject: [shadowknight] Re: re to latest stuffs :)


> From: bwh@... (Brian Hook)
>
> You make good points, and I alluded to some of those in my post -- I'm a
> great damage sponge, and that seems to be what you've offered as your best
> skill to your party. :-)
>
> However, I want to contribute actively -- and there's not many ways I can
> do that unfortunately.
>
> The image of an SK standing there taking damage while others do the "real"
> work seems out of whack with what an SK should be.
>
> I may stick it out with the SK a bit longer, if for no other reason than
it
> lets me tag along with my friends a bit more and I can thus check out some
> cool new locales (I just did the Qeynos->Freeport run last night, and I'd
> hate to quit now).
>
> I do think that my next character will be a ranger though, if I feel like
> going through the tedium of levelling up.
>
> Brian
>
>
